data.text:
April Recs (for real this time!)

this months theme: Places​

Owners

Rage

Song: Iron Maiden - Paschendale

Genre: NWOBHM/Heavy Metal

Description: A song about the battle of Paschendale, where a lot of Canadian soldeers fell in the first World War

Rage

Song: 2pac - California Love feat. Dr. Dre

Genre: Rap

Description: I was mind blown that nobody else recced this so I had to double dunk

Moderators

Buffy

Song: Loona - Vamos A La Playa

Genre: Pop

Description: One of the most fun songs to just bop to, especially in the summer. STAN the og Loona.

16bit

Song: Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young - Ohio

Genre: Folk Rock

Description: Phenomenal protest song that's message is still (sadly) super relevant

Clouds

Song: Khruangbin, Leon Bridges - Texas Sun

Genre: Alternative, Indie, Soul

Description: Not the only collaborative masterpiece between Khruangbin and Leon, but my favorite for sure.

MDM234

Song: Blind Guardian - Valhalla

Genre: Speed/Power Metal

Description: VALHALLA, DELIVERANCE WHY'VE YOU EVER FORGOTTEN ME. One of the most iconic choruses in metal history

noct

song: lcd soundsystem - new york, i love you, but you're bringing me down

genre: indietronica, dance-punk

description: take me off your mailing list, for the kids that thinks it still exists. melancholic, soft, but explodes into a beautiful end note to a perfect album

wishes

Song: The Neighbourhood – Greetings from Califournia

Genre: indie pop

Description: One of The NBHD's more unique songs. It describes Jesse's complex relationship to his home, California, along with the political climate there in 2015.

Peary

Song: John Denver - Take Me Home, Country Roads

Genre: Country Pop, Singer/Songwriter

Description: WEST VIRGINIAAAAAAAAAAA

CJEY

Song: Blah Blah Blah - Goodbye L.A

Genre: Pop

Drivers

Saiges

Song: Yukika - Soul Lady

Genre: K-pop

Description: very cute and city-pop inspired song from yukika :] love her aesthetic and sound

Raihan Kibana

Song: St Vincent - New York

Genre: Alternative/Indie

Description: New york isn't new york without you, love...

za

Song: Death - Crystal Mountain

Genre: Progressive Death Metal

Description: a classic and also my favorite death metal song of all time

Gota Love Yaoi

Song: Kanye West - Home

Genre: hip hop

Description: better than the version on graduation

jeromewt

Songs: J Dilla - Welcome 2 Detroit

Genre: Hip hop

Description: Beautiful intro to a beautiful album

Global Staff Recs

Segmr

Song: Calle 13 - La Perla Ft. Ruben Blades

Genre: Alternative Rap/Samba

Description: a love letter to one of the most historic settlements in puerto rico and it's people, with one of the great modern masters of salsa amping up that spirit.

May's Song Recommendations

Theme: Recommendation Auth Swap (Recs done by one staff member for another staff member)​

Owners

Rage

(by Jeromewt)

Song: Wu-Tang Clan - Protect Ya Neck

Genre: rap Description: goes hard

(by Raihan Kibana)

Song: Mitski - Pearl Diver

Genre: indie

wishes (by OM)

Song: Mahalia - What You Did (feat. Ella Mai) - Preditah Remix

Genre: Some mix of Pop & EDM & RnB

Description: [TBD]

Moderators

Peary (by Buffy)

Song: Freddie Gibbs - Crushed Glass

Genre: Rap

Description: Debatable that this is Freddie's best song overall and certainly a top contender at worst, especially amongst songs not on Bandana/Pinata.

Buffy (by Peary)

Song: Lolo Zouaï - Caffeine

Genre: Pop

Description: This song turns me up. Just like Doja Cat & Freddie Gibbs on a Saturday night

Lucian Paradox (by Saiges)

Song: Everglow - Bon Bon Chocolat

Genre: K-pop

Description: queens of girl crush concept and edm <3 one of my fav debuts

Noct (by 16bit)

Song: Kyuss - Whitewater

Genre: Stoner Metal

Description: Hi people noct here. Even though I used to be named after a tool album I actually never listen to metal except to Kyuss. Now this song is really great I love it, especially the last minute which is just euphoric and lifechanging stuff

16bit (by Noct)

Song: Queens of the Stone Age - Go With The Flow

Genre: stoner rock

Description: Hello guys SixteenBit here and I love Josh Homme so much and I have totally won aotd with queens of the stone age yeah woo.

CJEY (by Gota Love Yaoi)

Song: Mount Eerie - Seaweed

Genre: Folk

Description: It's me, CJEY, the newest moderator in the studio, and definitely not starblim. When I'm not listening to the newest fusion of emo and hyperpop, being brutally reminded of the fragility of life and the pain of losing a loved one hits different.

Gota Love Yaoi (by CJEY)

Song: Given - Mafuyus

Genre: Math rock

Description: when im not relistening to Sonic youths whole discography for the 700th time I really just kick back and relax to my favorite Yaoi series. Nothing beats a good old Boy Love.

Clouds (by Segmr)

Song: Frank Ocean - Pink + White

Genre: R&B

Desc: %ᵕ‿‿ᵕ%

Drivers

Saiges (by Lucian Paradox)

Song: STAYC - SO BAD

Genre: K-pop

Description: Rise of the Staycnators

jeromewt (by Rage)

Song: Isasiah Rashad - Soliloquy

Genre: Rap

Description: Best be streaming

Raihan Kibana (by Buffy)

Song: Evanescence - The End of The Dream

Genre: Alternative

Description: Amy Lee in perhaps the peak of her vocals.

Global Staff Recs

Segmr (by Clouds)

Song: Anderson .Paak, ScHoolboy Q - Am I Wrong

Genre: Neo Soul, R&B, Hip-Hop

Description: Always looking for an excuse to recommend my favorite artist (:

OM (by wishes)

Song: bleachers – rollercoaster ft. charli xcx

genre: pop / pop rock

description: really great combination of jack antonoff's production + charli's vocals that bounce off each other nicely. a remix of the original, this version of rollercoaster takes a new approach to the song with charli in it. generally just a really stellar track that i think you'd like!

June's Song Recommendations

Theme: Pokemon Types in Song Titles!​

Owners

Rage

Song: Judas Priest - The Hellion / Electric Eye

Genre: Heavy Metal

Description: One of the best intro / song combos of all time, and started Screaming For Vengeance off with a banger.

wishes

Song: SOPHIE – Is It Cold In The Water?

Genre: ambient pop

Description: sad and chilling

pablo

Song: Vance Joy - Fire and the Flood

Genre: Alternative/Indie

Brandon

Song: Willie Nelson - Angel Flying Too Close To The Ground

Genre: Country (the good kind)

Description: This song is so pretty idc

Moderators

Buffy

Song: Metallica - Trapped Under Ice

Genre: Metal

Description: It's a Metallica song from their best album: it's iconic.

Peary

Song: Kids See Ghosts - Fire

Genre: Experimental Hip-Hop, Pop Rap

Description: This Heat

MDM234

Song: Candlemass - Dark Are the Veils of Death

Genre: Epic Doom Metal

Description: "CandleYASS" - jon

Lucian Paradox

Song: BLACKPINK - PLAYING WITH FIRE

Genre: Kpop

Noct

Song: Songs: Ohia - I've Been Riding With The Ghost

Genre: alt-country

Description: one of my favorite songwriters of all time, jason molina, sings about loss, change, substance abuse, and makes it sound like it's the saddest fucking thing you've ever heard. musically it's fantastic, lyrically its fantastic, this entire album is fantastic.

16bit

Song: The Rolling Stones - Rocks Off

Genre: Blues Rock

Description: Feels like walking into a smoke filled bar and playing a game of pool

CJEY

Song: Sunny Day Real Estate - Roses In water

Genre: Alt Rock/Midwest Emo

Za

Song: Avantasia - Ghost in the Moon

Genre: Symphonic Power Metal

Description: The best song from an annoyingly inconsistent band

Gota Love Yaoi

Song: Neutral Milk Hotel - Ghost

Genre: Indie Rock

Description: Dee dee dee dee dee dee

Clouds

Song: Amy Winehouse – You Sent Me Flying

Genre: Soul/Jazz

Description: A favorite on her debut album, Frank, from '03

roviet

Song: Alex G - Bug

Genre: Indie pop

Drivers

Saiges

Song: Death Grips feat. Les Claypool - More Than The Fairy

Genre: Industrial Hip Hop

Description: its 4pm babe! time to plug a banana into an electrical socket

jeromewt

Song: Redveil - Grass

Genre: Hip hop

Raihan Kibana

Song: Touhou 18 - Dragon-King-Slaying Princess

Genre: OST

Description: Yup touhou 18 came out and its soundtrack fucking slaps

Voices

breakthru89

Song: Alexander Rybak - Fairytale

Genre: Folk / Pop

Description: Eurovision classic, this song is so fun, and I adore this violin (how can you not?????).

tomatopeeler

Song: 21 Savage, Offset & Metro Boomin - Ghostface Killers ft. Travis Scott

Genre: Trap

Description: Shoot the maggots... this is just a crazy track

namda

Song: Queen Bee - Fire

Genre: Japanese, J-Rock, J-Pop

Description: an absolute bop - the singer is amazing!!!

John

Song: Mew - A Dark Design

Genre: Dream Pop

Description: Always a fan of cheery sounding songs with dark lyrics.

TheJ3estPenguin

Song: SZA - Normal Girl

Genre: R&B

Description: i know yall didn't miss this.

Some extras that didn't make the cut for me​

Song: Kim Petras - Icy

Genre: Pop

Description: Picking between this, Heart To Break and All I Do Is Cry is like splitting hairs for me, but regardless this is easily a top 3 Kim song, is an absolute serve and really only didn't make this list since technically icy isn't a type.

Song: Metallica - Fight Fire With Fire

Genre: Metal

Description: How fitting that another track I wanted to go with this month is from the same, best Metallica album. It's pretty great how many elements are in song names from this album and this is def one of the best known songs from this album.

Song: Grimes - laughing and not being normal

Genre: Electronic

Description: Anyone who really knows my taste in music knows how obsessed with Grimes I am. This is probably the most overlooked track on Art Angels despite it being the opening track. While it may not shine as much as some of the other tracks on this album, lets be real: the whole album slaps af and this is still a really great song.

Song: Led Zeppelin - Rock and Roll

Genre: Classic Rock

Description: There are probably tons of rock songs with rock in the title and yet this probably still stands out the most. Led Zeppelin is so much the very definition of rock music to me and even though this may be a very popular and well known track, this still stands out as one of their best and an absolute classic.

Song: Metric - Breathing Underwater

Genre: Alternative

Description: Okay okay I know technically this is "underwater" which is 1 word, but eh close enough. For my water pick, I wanted to do something a bit less known and shine a spotlight on one of my favorite bands, who definitely deserve more streams.

Song: Lady Gaga - Dance In The Dark

Genre: Pop

Description: My favorite gaga song, super overlooked and hits so hard in many ways.

That's all (for now) folks! Hope you enjoy these extra themed recs!

Maybe I'll come back to this later and fill out the rest of the types.

July's Song Recommendations

Theme: Spotlight On An Unknown Artist!​

Owners

skies

Song: The Pom-Poms – Watch Me

Genre: pop

Description: i like the girls with their nails done long dance real hard to the emo songs

Moderators

Buffy

Songs: Metric - Speed The Collapse | Metric - Gold Guns Girls | Metric - The Shade | Metric - Risk | Metric - The Wanderlust

Genre: Alternative

Description: Metric has a very unique alternative sound and for my spotlight I've chosen songs from a bunch of different albums, so if you like each one, you'll have a lot of different albums to check out! Black Sheep is also one of their best (and you may know it from the Scott Pilgrim soundtrack). Definitely check 'em out!

Peary

Songs: PE$O PETE - MARINEFORD | PE$O PETE - Punk Hazard | PE$O PETE - Midnight Gospel Freestyle | PE$O PETE - FLARE BLITZ!

Genre: Trap, Nerdcore

Description: Been a fan since Pokemon Cypher 2019, PE$O can really rap well and I even have a collab song with him coming up

MDM234

Songs: Wilderun - Far From Where Dreams Unfurl | Wilderun - Seventh Son of a Seventh Son (Iron Maiden cover) | Wilderun - Storm Along | Wilderun - Bite the Wound (Ash Memory Part III) | Wilderun - When the Fire and the Rose Were One

Genre: Symphonic/Progressive Folk Metal

Description: One of my absolute favorite bands, incredibly over the top and cheesy take on folk metal, but they do it absolutely brilliantly. Veil of Imagination (my favorite album of 2019) and Sleep at the Edge of the Earth are absolute musts for anybody who has any sort of interest in cheesy metal at all. Can't recommend this band enough.

Noct

Songs: Mohama Saz - De Las Moscas Del Mercado | Mohama Saz - Hueso y Luz | Mohama Saz - Huracán Raki

Genre: psychedelic rock

Description: super cool spanish psych band with anatolian rock influences.

16bit

Song: Artist - Title?

Genre: J-pop, Progressive Pop, Nu-Jazz

Description: Honestly I could've put like 10 more genres here this dude is nuts, if you like this check out the EP this is from the entire thing is awesome

CJEY

Song: Kidsnorlax - Lost my DS stylus

Genre: Screamo / Hyperpop

Description: GAMEBOY SLUT

Za

Songs: Kyrbgrinder - Where Do We Go From Here | Kyrbgrinder - Cynical World

Genre: Progressive/Funk Metal

Description: Pretty unique 3-piece band fronted by Threshold drummer Johanne James, who is both the drummer and vocalist for Kyrbgrinder... they have released 3 albums, and their 2010 release Cold War Technology is the strongest of the 3, with the 2 songs linked being a couple of the highlights. I wanted to include one song from their 2015 album, which is also quite good, but it’s not uploaded anywhere on YouTube...

Gota Love Yaoi

Songs: Airospace - The Ailment We Call Envy | Airospace - Haruko (pt. II) | Airospace - Circle | Airospace - You Can't Fit A Square Peg In A Round Hole

Genre: Cloud Rap, Emo Rap, idfk

Description: I've been rockin with Airospace since like 2014, always wanted him to make it bigger. Super dark and depressing lyrics, cloudy beats, and extremely cathartic delivery.

Clouds

Songs: Lower Dens - Real Thing | Lower Dens - Ondine | Lower Dens - I Get Nervous | Lower Dens - I Drive | Lower Dens - To Die in L.A.

Genre: Indie Pop

Description: Headlined by Jana Hunter who is immensely talented & creative with mv concepts, reminds me a little of Avey Tare in terms of art style too. Lower Dens is based in Baltimore as well, just like Animal Collective, & they're a talented group that's released a lot of tracks that are nice to just like.. space out while listening to.

Drivers

Saiges

Song: Alice Glass - Forgiveness

Genre: witch house

Description: the hold that goth girls have on society...

jeromewt

Song: Durag Dynasty - Tender Greens | Planet Asia and Apollo Brown - Panties in a Jumble | Planet Asia - Over your head ft. Black Thought https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qH8t9Qo2mxI Planet Asia - Get Hit up ft. SmooVth

Genre: hip hop

Description: PA is one of the most slept on ever, dope lyricist and he makes you feel every word, perfect beat selection has worked with some of the greatest producers ever and he dropping fire since 99. He was in the group durag dynasty and got a lot of solo work too my favorite tapes from him are 360 waves, anchovies, and the medicine

Raihan Kibana

Songs: Diamanda Galás - Let My People Go | Diamanda Galás - Double-Barrel Prayer | Diamanda Galás - Deliver Me From Mine Enemies | Diamanda Galás - There Are No More Tickets to the Funeral

Genre: Avant-garde, Gothic Rock, Blues Rock

Description: No other word works here besides art. A large portion of her early work(the Plague Mass trilogy) is based heavily on church music being recontextualized to highlight the cruelty of the church during the AIDS crisis(fit with a satirical mockery of preaching). She's not afraid to go into full operatic screeching alongside her low register singing and blues piano playing to convey the ever-present anger in her music.

Voices

breakthru89

Songs: Daniel Romano - Rhythmic Blood | Daniel Romano - Between the Blades of Grass | Daniel Romano - Sucking The Old World Dry

Genre: Psychedelic rock, Folk

Description: Daniel Romano is a very cool guy style-wise, with a ton of random genres thrown in, mainly country, folk, and psychedelia. His voice is very nice to listen to and his songs are generally quite solid quality-wise. He has a ton of creative concepts with his music and I admire that. Just an overall cool guy with some bangers.

tomatopeeler

Songs: Roc Marciano - History | DJ MUGGS x ROC MARCIANO - Shit I'm On | Roc Marciano - Emeralds | Roc Marciano - Richard Gear

Genre: Hip hop

Description: great beats + great wordplay

namda

Songs: Tatsuya Kitani - Ghost!? | Tatsuya Kitani - HIDE AND SEEK

Genres: Jrock, alternative rock, indie rock

Description: (Ghost!?) very quirky with elements of jazz in Ghost!?, accompanied by a very interesting video. (HIDE AND SEEK) very fun rock song with super headbop vibes

August's Song Recommendations

Theme: The Name Game!

​

Owners

Rage

Songs: Black Sabbath - Evil Woman | Midnight - Woman of Flame

Genre: Heavy Metal | Black/Speed Metal

Description: One of Sabbath's first songs, a cover originally by the blues band Crow, and the second a fun song by a fun band, black/speed metal needs more love

skies

Songs: Aphex Twin - Nanou 2 | Tinashe - 2 On (Explicit) ft. SchoolBoy Q

Genre: Piano | Hip-hop

Description: Nanou 2 is a very chilling piano piece that will make you very sad but in a good way. On the other hand, 2 On is about partying and having fun with your girls! Aphex Twin and Tinashe would be an interesting collaboration, but for now we can go from getting misty eyed to immediately remembering how fun it is to party. Honestly? They're an unexpected but amazing duo; the ending of the piano in Nanou 2 perfectly starts the intro of 2 On!

Moderators

Buffy

Songs: Killswitch Engage - This Fire | The Prodigy - Firestarter

Genre: Metalcore | Electronic

Description: Easily Killswitch's best song. The instrumentation, lyrics and just how it's all put together is just perfection. And Firestarter is definitely a top 5 Prodigy song, just overall a very fun song and brings me back to Charlie's Angels days.

CJEY

Songs: Gang Starr - Moment of Truth | Fantasia - Truth is

Genre: Rap | R&B

Clouds

Songs: Fiona Apple - Sleep to Dream |

Genre: Pop, Indie Pop | New Wave

Description: Personally, I don't sleep to dream of Mickey Mantle. But some might! Sleep to Dream is my favorite track from Fiona's masterful album Tidal, while Dream of Mickey Mantle is a lesser known track from Bleachers. Together they don't have much synergy, but they do make a sentence, and that's what we're here for.(edited)

Noct

Songs: Stereolab - Les Yper-Sound | David Bowie - Sound Vision

Description: one of the more chill cuts off of ETK and the seminal song off of bowie's masterpiece, low. both songs bring a nice atmosphere, both are catchy, but yet experimental, and both happen to be one of my favorite bands and my all time favorite musical artist.

Za

Songs: System of a Down - Jet Pilot | Threshold - Pilot in the Sky of Dreams

Genre: Alternative Metal | Progressive Metal

Drivers

Raihan Kibana

Songs: Fiona Apple - Paper Bag | Mitski - Bag of Bones

Genre: Pop | Alt/Indie

Description: These are both piano-heavy songs about longing for love in an unfulfilling relationship from amazing lyricists so I think it fits. Paper Bag is definitely my favorite Fiona Apple, her singing on the track is just sublime. Bag of Bones is classic Mitski song, Lush has some of her best writing and singing imo and this song definitely fits that bill to me; when someone only likes you for your body then you're nothing but a used bag of bones trapped in the toxic relation by unrequited want for deeper love. Kinda extreme compared to Paper Bag but I suppose they still fit thematically

Voices

Breakthru89

Songs: Linda Ronstadt - You're No Good | The Beach Boys - Good Vibrations

Genre: Pop

Description: Two classics that just so happen to work together. one of ronstadt's absolute best cover songs, you're no good is a whole bop and a half. good vibrations is one of the most fun songs i've listened to. the vibe is so cool, and both are some of my fav artists in general.

Jeromewt

Songs: Ariana grande - goodnight n go | Sza - go gina

Genre: Pop | R&B

Description:

namda

Songs: YOASOBI - Racing into the Night | COOL&CREATE/BeatMARIO - Night of Nights

Genre: J-Pop | EDM

Description: Racing into the Night is the absolute BANGER that turned YOASOBI into one of the most popular artists in Japan! if you know japanese, (or google the lyrics' translations) it's quite a sad song but despite that it's still a BOP !!!! Night of Nights is a remix of a song called Flowering Nights from the Touhou games. Night of Nights is one of the songs that got me into the Japanese music scene and I will never forget this particular song - it's super catchy!

September's Song Recommendations

Theme: Genre Crossovers​

Owners

Rage

Song: Christina Aguilera fr. Redman | Dirrrty

Genre: Pop / Rap

Description: Christina goes hard and Redman always consistent wherever he shows up

skies

Song: The Neighbourhood | Givin N' Takin (feat. Danny Seth & DeJLoaf)

Genre: Indie Pop / British Rap

Description: a weird combination of british rap and an american indie pop band. this – b&w – is the nbhd's most experimental album featuring tons of hip-hop features and collaborations. this one in particular stands out because of the stark contrast between the two; the song feels like you're getting slung around but like in a good way

Moderators

Buffy

Song: Linkin Park + Jay-Z | Numb/Encore

Genre: Rap / Rock

Description: Pretty sure Linkin Park x Jay-Z is the origin of Rap Rock and this song just fuses the two genres so well.

CJEY

Song: Gazelle Twin & NYX | Fire Leap

Genre: Ritual Ambient / Choral / Post-Industrial

Gota^_^Love^_^Yaoi

Song: The Microphones | The Glow, Pt. 2

Genre: Folk / Noise Rock

Description:

If u listen 2 this song your crush will confess their love 4 u but if u dont u will never find love

noct

Song: Panopticon | Black Soot and Red Blood

Genre: Black Metal / Bluegrass

Description: has no right to be this good but it works

Peary

Song: CITY MORGUE | 33rd Blakk Glass

Genre: Trap Metal

Description: City Morgue is one of my personal fav artists in the emerging Trap Metal scene that blends elements from both Trap Rap and Metal

Raihan Kibana

Song: Diamanda Galás & John Paul Jones | Hex

Genre: Avant-garde / Rock / Blues

Description: This song sounds exactly like how you'd expect this collaboration to sound like. Galás doing her crazy shit singing fully in Greek backed by organ and a banging rhythm section.

za

Song: Mr. Bungle | Egg

Genre: Avant-garde Metal / Experimental Rock / Jazz / Ska / other things

Description: It's hard to describe exactly the type of music that Mr. Bungle makes, but whatever it is, I like it

Drivers

saiges

Song: The Garden (feat. Mac DeMarco) | Thy Mission

Genre: Punk / Indie

Description: a cute collab and the whistles make me feel like im playing wii sports(edited)

Voices

breakthru89

Song: Eminem ft. Dido | Stan

Genre: Rap / Pop

Description: one of the most haunting songs of the early 2000s, and the origin of the term "stan". one of the best m&m tracks, and poignant documentation of the darker powers of fame

LadyxBeans

Song: King Crimson | Fracture

Genre: Prog Rock / Instrumental

Description: One of the only songs off of Starless and Bible Black to not be a full improv piece and a song that took a man 22 years to learn. Sounds Villainous
